This ensures the other memory operand &quot; &quot;instructions have the same identifiers after inserting &quot; &quot;prefetches, allowing for successive insertions.&quot;), cl::Hidden)</>}

<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;Location, unsigned&gt;</a> MemOpDiscriminators;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  MemOpDiscriminators&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-x86discriminatememops-cpp-/#a90d3213046a9833e35ee3f872822681b">diToLocation</a>(ReferenceDI)&#93; = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Figure out the largest discriminator issued for each Location. When we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// issue new discriminators, we can thus avoid issuing discriminators</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// belonging to instructions that don&#39;t have memops. This isn&#39;t a requirement</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for the goals of this pass, however, it avoids unnecessary ambiguity.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a> : MF) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Keep track of the discriminators seen at each Location. If an instruction&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// DebugInfo has a Location and discriminator we&#39;ve already seen, replace its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// discriminator with a new one, to guarantee uniqueness.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DenseMap&lt;Location, DenseSet&lt;unsigned&gt;&gt; Seen;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!EncodedDiscriminator) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME(mtrofin): The assumption is that this scenario is infrequent/OK</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// not to support. If evidence points otherwise, we can explore synthesizeing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unique DIs by adding fake line numbers, or by constructing 64 bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// discriminators.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">          <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Unable to create a unique discriminator &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;for instruction with memory operand in: &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     &lt;&lt; DI-&gt;getFilename() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot; Line: &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; DI-&gt;getLine()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot; Column: &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; DI-&gt;getColumn()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;. This is likely due to a large macro expansion. \\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since we were able to encode, bump the MemOpDiscriminators.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">        ++MemOpDiscriminators&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">        DI = DI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation/#ab7345daa994ad45abb206b757dda7f22">cloneWithDiscriminator</a>(&#42;EncodedDiscriminator);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(DI &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;DI should not be nullptr&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-x86discriminatememops-cpp-/#ab16949db62e9b18d3c4d1abc4fd651bb">updateDebugInfo</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>, DI);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">        std::pair&lt;DenseSet&lt;unsigned&gt;::iterator, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&gt; MustInsert =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">            <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/objcopy/#aa91a92d1d1ad7e8b84c1ecdceb0a439fa5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b">Set</a>.insert(DI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation/#a959d7d5282de6f6f459425591e7482d7">getBaseDiscriminator</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (void)MustInsert; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Silence warning in release build.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MustInsert.second &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;New discriminator shouldn&#39;t be present in set&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Bump the reference DI to avoid cramming discriminators on line 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME(mtrofin): pin ReferenceDI on blocks or first instruction with DI</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in a block. It&#39;s more consistent than just relying on the last memop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction we happened to see.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ReferenceDI = DI;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a>;</span></CodeLine>
